In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is how you can define the `wrap_string` function in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(str, text_width = 10)
    words = split(str, " ") # split string into array of words
    wrapped_str = "" # output string
    line = ""         # current line string

    for word in words
        if length(line * " " * word) > text_width # check if adding the new word would exceed width
            wrapped_str *= "$line\n"             # add a new line to the output and reset the current line
            line = ""                             
        end
        line *= " " * word  # add the word to the current line string
    end

    wrapped_str *= "$line"   # add the last line of text after the loop
    return wrapped_str
end
```

An example of using this function is:

```julia
print(wrap_string("This is a test. It has multiple sentences.", 10))
```
Output would be:
```
This is a 
test. It 
has multiple 
sentences.
```
The string "This is a test. It has multiple sentences." is wrapped after every `text_width=10` characters, resulting in new lines.
